title: UBS, law firms help stitch up $854 million Webster takeover
text:
Canadian pension fund manager PSP Investments has finally come knocking for ASX-listed water entitlements and cropping business Webster.

Just over a year after buying a 19 per cent stake in Webster, PSP has come back with a complex $854 million bid for the whole lot, in conjunction with a follow on deal to sell some assets to Webster chairman Chris Corrigan and fellow board member David Fitzsimons.

At $2 a share, the bid was at a 57 per cent premium to the last close. It was also at the same price PSP paid for its initial stake last August.

Webster produced more than 200,000 bales of cotton in 2018. Peter Braig

It is understood UBS and King & Wood Mallesons advised PSP, which has quickly emerged as a big investor in Australian agriculture assets.

OB Law advised Webster. KPMG Corporate Finance was hired to run the independent expert's report.
description: Canadian pension fund manager PSP Investments has finally come knocking for ASX-listed water entitlements and cropping business Webster.
